base_note.note_text:
NAVIGATION BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: 2025-09-13
Patient: Susan Lee | MRN: 2885591 | Age: 58F
Attending: Dr. Michael Park, MD | Fellow: Dr. Karen Chen (PGY-6)
Location: UCSF Medical Center, San Francisco, CA

INDICATION: 15mm LUL ground-glass nodule (SUV 3.2), bronchus sign positive. Biopsy for diagnosis.

PROCEDURE: Ion robotic bronchoscopy with transbronchial cryobiopsy

Under GA, Ion platform registration performed (fiducial-less, registration error 1.2mm). Navigation to LUL anterior segment (LB3). Radial EBUS showed concentric lesion view. Target lock confirmed. 

Cryoprobe (1.9mm) advanced under augmented fluoroscopy. Tool-in-lesion confirmed on CBCT. 3 cryobiopsies obtained (4-second freeze time each). Specimens 3-4mm, sent to surgical pathology. Mild bleeding controlled with wedge technique. No pneumothorax on completion fluoro.

FINDINGS: r-EBUS concentric view, CBCT TIL confirmed, adequate specimens

SPECIMENS: Cryobiopsy LUL x 3 - surgical pathology

COMPLICATIONS: Mild bleeding - self-limited
DISPOSITION: Outpatient discharge after 2hr CXR

Dr. Michael Park, MD

coding_review.overall_assessment: Robotic navigation with radial EBUS and cryobiopsy for nodule diagnosis.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation (add-on)
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes +31627, +31654, 31629; total_work_rvu=7.42, total_rvu=11.07 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Pamela Reyes
Medical Record Number: 4322142
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-11-05

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with lul ground-glass nodule workup. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Navigational Bronchoscopy:

Radial Ebus:
Endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration was performed utilizing real-time sonographic guidance for precise lymph node targeting. 
Transbronchial Cryobiopsy:
Transbronchial lung parenchymal sampling was performed utilizing standard forceps technique with fluoroscopic localization to minimize pneumothorax risk. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
r-EBUS concentric view, CBCT TIL confirmed, adequate specimens


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31627, 31654, 31629

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE - CODING DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

Patient: Angela Singh | MRN: 2208897 | DOS: 2024-12-26

CPT CODE JUSTIFICATION
----------------------------------------

CPT 31627:
  Rationale: Navigational bronchoscopy (Ion robotic) add-on

CPT 31654:
  Rationale: Radial EBUS for peripheral lesion (add-on)
  Facility RVU: 2.11
  Facility Payment: $68

CPT 31629:
  Rationale: TBNA for parenchymal lesion sampling (cryobiopsy)

DOCUMENTED TECHNIQUES AND EQUIPMENT
----------------------------------------

  • Cryoprobe
  • Ion robotic
  • fluoroscopy

PROCEDURE-SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION:

NAVIGATIONAL BRONCHOSCOPY:
  - Platform: Ion
  - Target Lobe: LUL
  - Registration Error Mm: 1.2

RADIAL EBUS:
  - Probe Position: Concentric

TRANSBRONCHIAL CRYOBIOPSY:
  - Number Of Samples: 3
  - Cryoprobe Size Mm: 1.9
  - Freeze Time Seconds: 4

TOTAL RVU SUMMARY:
----------------------------------------
  Total Facility RVU: 2.11
  Total Facility Payment: $68.0

Documentation supports medical necessity and procedure complexity as coded.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2025-10-06
Patient: Diana Hall
MRN: 4926968
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
LUL ground-glass nodule workup

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
General

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Navigational Bronchoscopy performed
5. Radial Ebus performed
6. Transbronchial Cryobiopsy performed
7. Scope withdrawn
8. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
3-4mm, sent to surgical pathology. Mild bleeding controlled with wedge technique. No pneumothorax on completion fluoro.

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31627, 31654, 31629

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2024-09-12, Mary Walker, a None-year-old patient (MRN 5792032), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for LUL ground-glass nodule workup. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included navigational bronchoscopy, radial ebus, and transbronchial biopsy for tissue sampling. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. Abnormal findings were noted as described in detail above. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is pending. 

Procedural coding: 31627, 31654, 31629.
